intro: Brachyscome smithwhitei, commonly known as the Smithwhite's bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as gravelly plains and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is listed as vulnerable due to habitat loss.
